summary:
The atmosphere was electric as the whistle blew, signaling the start of the intense derby between AS Roma and Lazio. The match got underway with AS Roma controlling the kick-off. Fans were barely settled into their seats before the first officiating decision—an offside call against Lazio at just 28 seconds into the game—demonstrated the early attacking intent from both teams.

AS Roma followed this with an indirect free-kick and quickly troubled the Lazio defense with a shot on target in the second minute. Though the effort did not yield a goal, it was a clear statement of their attacking prowess. The first few minutes saw a flurry of activity with the ball going out of play multiple times, largely facilitated by AS Roma’s aggressive play and their dominance in winning throw-ins and corners. Despite their early pressure, their attempts were contained by the composed defense of Lazio.

Lazio's first significant threat came around the 10th minute mark. Lucas Biglia seized an opportunity from just outside the box but sent his effort narrowly wide of the left post. This seemed to embolden Lazio, and moments later, when they tested Wojciech Szczesny with a shot on target, they did not miss their mark. In the 11th minute, Balde Keita exhibited exceptional dribbling skills, weaving past opponents to unleash a magnificent strike from the edge of the box. The goal settled into the bottom right corner, putting Lazio ahead and leaving Szczesny with no chance to save it. With the score now 1-0 in favor of Lazio, momentum appeared to shift.

AS Roma restarted with a sense of urgency, attempting to regain dominance. They pushed forward, forcing Lazio into defensive actions; however, Lazio held their ground effectively. Frustration for AS Roma was evident as Radja Nainggolan was penalized for a holding foul, impeding Lazio's ability to play cleanly. Despite AS Roma's persistent efforts, their shots either went off target or were saved by Lazio’s attentive goalkeeper, Thomas Strakosha.

Lazio was not without their own scare; a notable save by Wojciech Szczesny kept them from extending their lead further. Marco Parolo's ferocious strike was blocked by the AS Roma keeper, who performed admirably to deny the effort to the bottom right corner.

As the first half progressed, Lazio's defensive solidity was underlined by a series of clearances and disciplined plays. The game saw a temporary halt when Jordan Lukaku had to be substituted due to an injury, with Felipe Anderson taking his place. The substitution seemed to embolden Lazio, helping them maintain defensive composure.

The climax of the first half unfolded in the 44th minute. Wallace brought down an AS Roma player in the penalty area, resulting in a penalty for Roma. This spot-kick was confidently converted by Daniele De Rossi, who slotted the ball into the bottom right corner, leaving the score tied at 1-1 heading into the half-time break, even as tempers briefly flared with Lucas Biglia attempting to contest the penalty decision.

The second half commenced with a change for AS Roma, as they brought on Bruno Peres to replace Stephan El Shaarawy. Lazio kicked off and quickly found themselves defending against a rejuvenated AS Roma side looking to seize control early. Within two minutes of the half, Edin Dzeko's powerful shot was thwarted by a superb save from Thomas Strakosha, who parried it away for a corner.

Despite AS Roma's revitalized efforts, it was Lazio who struck again. In the 5th minute of the second half, Dusan Basta latched on to a precise pass just outside the box and drilled a goal into the bottom left corner via the post. Szczesny, helpless to stop the powerful shot, saw his team fall behind 2-1.

AS Roma resumed play, searching for an equalizer but were once again met with a sturdy Lazio defense. Lazio pressed their advantage, with Keita Balde continuing to be actively involved in their attacks, keeping AS Roma's defense occupied. A moment of misfortune for AS Roma arose when Kevin Strootman's promising strike was blocked by a defender, foiling their attempt to level the game.

A pivotal moment for Lazio came when Szczesny denied Felipe Anderson, darting into the penalty area and unleashing a low shot, only for the keeper to make a timely save. This ensured Lazio maintained their slender lead.

As the clock ticked on, substitutions were made to inject fresh legs into both sides. Federico Fazio made way for Diego Perotti in AS Roma lineup, while Stefan de Vrij was replaced by Wesley Hoedt for Lazio. The changes on the pitch highlighted both teams' strategic adjustments to sustain or overturn the result.

The game took a decisive turn once more in the 39th minute when Balde Keita crowned his brilliant performance with another goal. Benefiting from Senad Lulic’s pivotal role in the build-up, Keita Keita delivered a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner, making it 3-1 in favor of Lazio. The match now appeared firmly in Lazio’s control.

The closing stages saw AS Roma struggle to regain composure. Frustrations boiled over when Antonio Rudiger received a red card for a rash tackle, leaving AS Roma down to 10 men and further denting their hopes of mounting a comeback. The dismissal effectively ended any remaining momentum Roma could muster as they faced the final minutes at a numerical disadvantage.

With time running out, Lazio managed to hold on securely to their lead. The final attempts by AS Roma were thwarted by a combination of disciplined defense and strategic play from the Lazio players. Marco Parolo's late yellow card for dissent was just one of several instances that highlighted the heightened emotions in such a heated derby.

At the final whistle, Lazio emerged victorious with a well-deserved 3-1 win over their city rivals. The game had been a showcase of tactical discipline from Lazio, effective use of opportunities, and a determined defensive display. In contrast, AS Roma's efforts were commendable but ultimately fell short against a more clinical and resilient Lazio side.

This derby match not only highlighted individual brilliance, especially from the likes of Balde Keita, who was instrumental in Lazio's victory, but also showcased the importance of maintaining composure and taking decisive opportunities when they present themselves. As the stands emptied and fans reflected on the contest, the dramatics of the game would resonate till the next Rome derby, leaving Lazio with bragging rights over the Eternal City.
